Title: Consulting Internship, Healthcare: Advanced Degree Students, Class of 2021
Required Qualifications: At ECG, our primary emphasis is on quality—in our people and our services. When you work at ECG, we empower you to be your best. We hire you for your ability, integrity, and education, and we assign you challenging projects and help you grow professionally. Our Healthcare Consulting Internship provides a challenging and rewarding opportunity to students during the summer prior to their final year of their advanced degree studies. Interns work alongside our talented team of consultants, gaining valuable industry exposure and a wealth of knowledge. The program runs for 10 to 12 weeks during the summer of 2020. As an intern for ECG, you are part of the team: a resource to be utilized, not simply someone to push paper. You will be hired into one of our five divisions (Strategy and Business Advisory, Performance Transformation, Provider Financial Services, Managed Care Services, and Academic Healthcare) and be part of a team offering a comprehensive suite of innovative, yet practical solutions to address the most complex and high-stakes challenges facing today’s healthcare providers. You will gain a greater understanding of how we as consultants help our clients improve the delivery of healthcare, as well as a sense of satisfaction and accomplishment from your meaningful contributions to client projects, Additionally, you will be assigned an independent project and have an opportunity to present it to the firm at the end of your internship. As an ECG intern, your responsibilities may include: Analyzing, synthesizing, and interpreting data to inform client recommendations. Utilizing financial modeling to conduct in-depth analyses and recommend executable strategies. Assisting in developing and managing work plans, schedules, and budgets. Assisting with client proposal development. Defining project analyses and deliverables. Working on multiple engagements. Communicating project progress and seeking input. Developing depth of technical expertise. Requirements: Graduating with the class of 2021 with a master’s degree in business administration and/or a health-related field (consideration will be given to students graduating in December 2020) Three or more years of applicable professional experience prior to graduate school (e.g., healthcare consulting and/or hospital administration/operations) or a strong business background in strategic operations, finance, or consulting Strong knowledge of and passion for the healthcare industry Proven track record of solving complex problems and completing challenging projects Demonstrated diagnostic, analytical, and quantitative skills Advanced Microsoft Excel expertise Track record of excellence and passion for client service Demonstrated career progression with increasing responsibilities Strong written and verbal presentation skills Willingness to travel as needed ECG is a strategic consulting firm that is leading healthcare forward using knowledge and expertise built over the course of more than four decades to help clients see clearly where the industry is going and navigate toward success. We work as trusted, professional partners with hospitals, health systems, medical groups, and academic medical centers across the country. We thrive on delivering smart counsel and pragmatic solutions to the critical challenges facing healthcare providers. Client success is our primary objective. ECG’s national presence includes offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Minneapolis, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, St. Louis, and Washington, DC. Our company culture is open, honest, and collaborative, with a defined career path to help you succeed in a meritocratic environment. We offer an attractive compensation package, challenging and rewarding work, and a stellar reputation. To begin the recruitment process, please submit your resume and cover letter via the Careers page of our website at http://www.ecgmc.com. ECG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ECG does not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of any characteristic or activity that is legally protected, including race; ancestry; creed; color; religion; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; families with children; familial status; sex; genetic information; marital status; sexual orientation, gender expression, or gender identity; political ideology; age; honorably discharged veteran or military status; sensory, physical, or mental impairment; or other legally protected characteristics or activities. We participate in E-Verify as part of our onboarding process

Title: Pharmaceutical Consulting Intern
Required Qualifications:
Innovative Science Solutions (ISS)a Cello Health business is a boutique scientific consulting company serving the worldwide pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, cosmetics, food, and dietary supplement industries. We are a team of scientists, regulatory strategists, and consultants providing a wide range of fully integrated scientific consulting services to both industry and counsel. From FDA Advisory Committee meetings to support of complex, science-based litigation, ISS delivers specialized solutions for business hurdles. For more information about our firm visit us at www.innovativescience.net.

You have high expectations for yourself and your career, so does ISS. Imagine what we will achieve together.

Responsibilities
• Identify and analyze clinical/regulatory information to support a variety of projects
• Scientific literature searching and curation
• Database management and implementation
• Evaluate accuracy and quality of work product deliverables
• Learn to conceive and formulate effective marketing strategies designed to sell our company’s services

Requirements

The ideal candidate is inquisitive, ambitious, hardworking and has a strong interest in the healthcare field, including the following characteristics:
• Pursuing a degree in a life science or related field
• Interest in regulatory affairs, medical affairs or clinical research
• Proficient and comfortable with scientific/medical data and nomenclature
• Desire to become proficient in effectively communicating complex scientific and regulatory principles to non-scientists (as well as to scientists and healthcare professionals)
• Proficient with Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint
• Expert skills in internet searching and web browsing
• Eagerness to work independently and in teams in a fast-paced environment
• Extremely comfortable reviewing and interpreting scientific charts, tables and figures
• Passion for producing and presenting scientific data in oral presentations or written reports

Title: Pharmacy and Health Services Marketing Strategy Internship (Graduate)
Required Qualifications:
Job Description

Start date: June 7th, 2021
End Date: August 13th, 2021
Location: To ensure the health and safety of our colleagues, this position will be work-at-home.

CVS Health is the nation's premier health innovation company helping people on their path to better health. We are building a new health care model that is easier to use, less expensive, and puts the consumer at the center of their care.

Our Corporate Internship Program is a nationally recognized experience; it is also a great way to gain confidence, sharpen your skills, and make a difference.

You Will Gain Valuable Work Experience And Participate In
• Projects that contribute to the success of our business
• Community service initiatives
• Mentorship and networking opportunities
• Interaction with senior leaders

What This Business Area Supports

This role supports the Pharmacy & Health Services Marketing Strategy team, which drives Marketing planning across CVS Pharmacy retail including loyalty programs like CarePass, pharmacy services like Flu and COVID-19 vaccines as well as clinical healthcare services, including MinuteClinic, HealthHUB, and Transformational innovation (ie. medical alert systems, nutrition, behavioral health).

What You Will Do
• Own 1-2 significant strategic projects that showcase your ability to leverage consumer insights, market trends, and internal data to determine addressable/attainable business opportunities and translate them into an effective marketing plan.
• Drive Marketing creative work and may encompass writing strategic Marketing briefs and managing the work through the review process with Legal, Regulatory, Privacy and other business partner stakeholders.
• Additionally, this role will have the opportunity to be exposed to other areas of Marketing strategy, ranging from Digital and Operations to Public Relations and Marketing Analytics.

Required Qualifications
• 1+ year of relevant work experience.
• 1+ year of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint experience
• Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills
• Demonstrated leadership, experience and initiative
• Desire to work in a collaborative team environment

Preferred Qualifications
• Consulting or related high level analytical experience in an operational environment with experience in building complex business models Please remove this
• Demonstrated experience with spreadsheets, databases, and presentation software
• Demonstrated evidence of being a self-starter; results and outcomes-oriented
• Open to feedback and constantly reflecting and learning with desire to improve
• Able to work with others to drive cross-functional solutions
• Ability to push beyond the obvious; does not jump too quickly to a conclusion
• Open communication style with organized, structured points

Education
• You should currently be pursuing an MBA
• Have an anticipated graduation date between September 2021 and August 2022

Business Overview

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities

Title: Digital Healthcare Transformation Intern
Required Qualifications:
Make your mark for patients.

We’re here because we want to build the future and transform patients’ lives for the better.

At UCB, our people are our experiences and achievements, our passion and drive. That’s why we’re looking for talented individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences - not just the best and brightest, but those who care about making a meaningful difference in the lives of patients. We promote an environment of diversity, openness, and respect where people can make valuable contributions.

An exciting journey lies ahead. Will you join us in pushing the boundaries of what’s possible?

The Neurology Digital Care Transformation Team is looking for two motivated summer interns who understands where business and technology converges in creating the future of healthcare – and are excited about it! The interns will be assisting with the coordination of the Digital Transformation strategic planning journey and the deployment of an innovation incubator/accelerator program, whereby he/she is expected to help by conducting research, attending co-creation workshops, generating insights on recommendations as well as taking an active role in supporting the workstreams with innovative ideas and out-of-the-box thinking.

Our company is working on innovative new developments and will offer a solid education to interns of all levels. This is an exciting opportunity for young professionals, and we look forward to working with the interns as they develop their skills.

A laptop and other resources necessary to support the work will be provided.

This paid internship is currently expected to run from mid-May and continue through August 2021; subject to changes in the program plan, we expect to hire an intern on a part-time basis until August 2021, estimated at 10-40 hours per week on a flexible basis.

This internship will be 100% remote

SKILLS:
• Must be tech savvy and have a growth mindset and innovative nature
• Strong Interpersonal and Communication Skills
• Self-starter; can work independently
• Ability to shift focus across tasks as needed and manage priorities
• Previous experience in innovation lifecycle management preferred

About us.

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 7,600 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

At UCB, everything we do start with a simple question: “How will this create value for people living with severe disease?”. We are on a journey to become the patient-preferred biopharma leader by delivering medicines and solutions that improve lives. We want to ensure the creation of patient value, now and into the future, while contributing to a society where a population of 8 billion people and more should be able to live a good life within limited resources of one planet.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity

Title: East – New York – Consulting – Health Intern – Summer 2021
Required Qualifications:
EY Consulting Finance Summer Associate To be considered for an interview at EY
• Apply using your school’s online recruiting system
• Apply through our online system at www.ey.com/us/apply. Select the job description for which you are applying: MBA Internship Application – U.S. UNI00BYN

At EY Consulting, we are building a better working world by transforming businesses through the power of people, technology and innovation. Our clients are at the heart of what we do. We’re focused on solving the key issues of our client buyers, building deeper relationships and making a greater impact with long-term value.

The opportunity

You’ll help our clients with transformation and innovation: driving growth, reducing costs, or proactively managing risks. With support from a highly talented and committed team, you’ll design strategies and build solutions in a variety of specialty areas. If you’re looking to build you career in a fast-moving, high-growth service area with huge potential, this role is for you.
What to expect

Based on your existing experience, knowledge and ambitions, you could find yourself working alongside any one of our competencies, assisting clients to drive business-led and technology-enabled transformations across a broad range of business issues. You will work with your clients and project teams to identify the root cause of problems, co-develop solutions, and engage with key stakeholders to monitor progress, manage risk, and ensure continued alignment on expected outcomes.

As part of the Finance team you’ll be a work stream leader, taking control of sub-sets of complex projects and leading junior staff within your team. You’ll be seen as the leading expert on your engagement, in the piece of the project you own, so you’ll need to understand the intricacies of each project and desired objectives, and eventually credibility among seniors to show equity of work and progress. This is an exciting opportunity where you’ll have unique projects with great people to solve problems you haven’t seen before. You’ll be building relationships with the CFOs of tomorrow, so if you’re passionate about driving outcomes, can translate complex information in a way that will resonate with your client, and can jump right into cutting-edge projects, this role is for you. Ideal candidates will have exposure to one of more of the following:
• Experience in public accounting, corporate finance, or as a business analyst
• Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma or other approaches to process improvement, financial modeling or data analytics, or other approaches to using data to help clients make better business decisions
• Interest in robotics and digital tools, and how the latest technology impacts the business world
• Intellectual curiosity, and an interest in problem solving and working in an ever-changing environment
• Desire to have a positive impact on companies that operate globally, as well as here in the US

Work locations: Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco, Seattle and Washington DC.
Preferred qualifications may include
• A bachelor’s degree and approximately 3-7 years of related work experience
• Pursuing a MBA, MS, MHA, MPA or PhD degree
• A collaborative approach to work, and the motivation to develop your skills by taking ownership of new challenges
• A genuine interest in solving complex business problems
• Excellent presentation skills, and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts simply and effectively to all audiences
• Strong leadership skills and a desire to build cutting-edge solutions
• Ability to take initiative and drive execution with minimal supervision
• Significant work experience within industry or consulting
• Ability to use Microsoft Suite programs
• A willingness and ability to travel up to 80% to client sites
• A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
What we look for

We’re interested in intellectually curious people, with a passion for helping drive clients’ growth. You’ll also possess good business acumen, excellent organizational skills, and a proven record of multitasking and working effectively across multiple projects. If you’re ready to build on your potential, develop as a consultant, and join a growing team, this role is for you.
What working at EY offers

If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.

Plus, we offer:
• Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
• Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
• Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your engagement teams
About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy and transaction services and Consulting services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply today

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number 63879. Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information

Title: Healthcare Consulting Intern
Required Qualifications:
BlackTree was founded in July of 2011 with the goal of providing client-centric services to the home care, hospice and skilled nursing industries. Our organization has grown to a team of over 170 staff members made up of clinical, operational, and revenue cycle personnel to support our clients. BlackTree has developed a full suite of custom-designed consulting services focusing on areas critical to quality improvement, operational efficiency, accurate reimbursement, and regulatory compliance.

Additionally, in order to provide our clients with an opportunity to focus on core operations, BlackTree provides outsourcing services for Coding and OASIS reviews, Billing and Collections, and full Revenue Cycle services. BlackTree has worked with over 500 clients, ranging from small, community-based agencies to publicly traded national chains. We have both the technical expertise and the real-world experience to implement seamless solutions that assist agencies in a rapidly changing operational and regulatory environment.

Our primary focus is the provision of superior consulting services to the Homecare and Hospice industry. Our Analyst internship is for our entry-level consulting position within BlackTree Healthcare Consulting. Engagements completed at the Analyst level serve as the foundation for growth within the company, and strengthen the expertise needed to provide exceptional consulting services. We are looking for full- or part-time interns for the Spring semester as well as the Summer. This position will start fully remote but could eventually move on-site to our headquarter office in King of Prussia, PA.

Requirements

The primary responsibilities of an Analyst intern will be the completion of client projects and development of their Homecare financial and operational expertise.

Essential functions and responsibilities of this role include:

· Accounts Receivable Support

· Revenue Cycle-based projects

· Financial Analysis and reporting

· Regulatory Research

· Other Responsibilities as Assigned

Qualifications

Interested candidates should have an outstanding intellectual capability, maturity and judgment. Successful candidates will meet the following qualifications:

· Working toward a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Health Policy Administration or Accounting with a G.P.A. of 3.0 or greater

· Proficiency with Microsoft Office

· Excellent written and verbal skills

· Strong quantitative and analytic skills

· Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing working environment

· Excellent interpersonal skills, and an aggressive approach to excellence

Benefits

Our Mission & Culture

Our clients are some of the largest home care and hospice agencies in the nation, all working to better their operations, and ultimately the level of care their patients receive. Our goal is to partner with our clients to assist them in better achieving their financial and operational objectives. In order to attain this, BlackTree is committed to developing and empowering our employees to become industry leaders, capable of continuing the quality on which BlackTree was founded.

We’re a team of close to 100 employees based in the Greater Philadelphia Area, but also have remote staff across the country. Our culture and success is a direct reflection of our people, and we remain dedicated to developing exceptional talent within the firm. At BlackTree, we share a simple vision built by the five founders; work hard, play hard and give back

Title: Healthcare Operations Summer Internship
Required Qualifications:
From our Dallas corporate headquarters to our clinics, worksites, and mobile locations, Concentra colleagues remain focused on our driving purpose: to provide superb patient and employer experience by delivering the highest quality healthcare in an efficient, affordable, caring manner. We do this by putting all customers (internal and external) first and by displaying:
• A healing focus
• A selfless heart
• A tireless resolve

Overview

Responsibilities

This 12 week program is designed for college juniors or seniors who wish to study and experience the operations of a large healthcare corporation. The internship includes participatory as well as observational activities. The intern will be given work assignments applicable to his/her career development. Opportunities for new skill development include participating as a team member, focusing on quality outcomes, and evaluating work output.

Program

The internship program will consist of classroom lecture and of supervised work experience. Each student will be assigned a mentor who will meet weekly with the intern and will guide his/her experience. The intern will identify two individuals within the corporation that he/she will shadow for a half day. The intern will tour a local clinic and corporate departments. Weekly reading assignments, group discussions and Learning Luncheons will be a part of the experience.

Qualifications

Education/credentials

Currently working towards a Bachelor’s degree.

Additional Data

Concentra is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Veterans/Disabled
